channel.title: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras
channel.description:
Hi guys,
Just though I´d post this in case anyone wants replay classic C&C but modified with several extras, here is the description:
Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 (will also work on XP)
Includes:
- Original GDI & NOD Campaings - Covert Ops Expansion Pack - Extra Missions & Content released only on the PSX version - Reworked & Remastered Soundtrack and effects - High Res Pack (1280x768) - Community Made 1.06c Patch - Multiplayer Mode
Install Instructions:
There are 6 steps, each named indicating what you should do with them. No need to use "compatibilty" options Once all steps are done, run the executable.
Issues:
The image has a weird bug due to map size compared to resolution in the first 3 missions of each campaing, you can ignore it as it doesnt affect playibility. FMVs display to the top left of the screen as the resolution is higuer than the videos. If you experience weird colours other than the intro, just alt+tab to desktop and go back in or go in to a menu option (if you pause and alt+tab, when you go back the colours would be weird but fixed as soon as you un-pause.
Done by the good guys at digiex. Put togueter in a complete package by Luciel @ cd-2-dvd.com
We miss you Westwood Studios : (
Follow Kane, fight for NOD, peace through power!! ps: since C&C95 is now freeware, this torrent is completely legal : )
---------------------------
The torrent link: [url]https://isohunt.com/torrent_details/345936793/command+%26+conquer?tab=summary[/url]
It´s tons of fun, enjoy! :smiley:

item.title: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
robot_deodorant:

To install Red Alert 1 all you need to do is copy everything from the INSTALL folder (either disc) to C:\Westwood\RA95\ or wherever you want the game directory.

After that you should copy *.mix from both discs (skipping ones that are already copied) to the same folder, however that is optional (FMV files, etc).

Then go here:
Nyerguds TFD fixes page

Grab the Red Alert 3.03 Patch, which will vastly improve the game and install both expansions.

Also:
C&C95 Gold 1.06 Project

That is where the ongoing work on C&C95 is located. Luciel is right, the original C&C games are all Freeware now.

Good info mate, also the 1.06c patch is included in the torrent : )

Read full topic
item.source: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras

item.title: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras
item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
coldroll:

Has anyone made a Windows 7 x64 patch for Red alert yet?

To install Red Alert 1 all you need to do is copy everything from the INSTALL folder (either disc) to C:\Westwood\RA95\ or wherever you want the game directory.

After that you should copy *.mix from both discs (skipping ones that are already copied) to the same folder, however that is optional (FMV files, etc).

Then go here:
Nyerguds TFD fixes page

Grab the Red Alert 3.03 Patch, which will vastly improve the game and install both expansions.

Also:
C&C95 Gold 1.06 Project

That is where the ongoing work on C&C95 is located. Luciel is right, the original C&C games are all Freeware now.

Read full topic
item.source: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras

item.title: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
Has anyone made a Windows 7 x64 patch for Red alert yet? I remember back in 2000 when I used to watch my dad play it every day when I was six.

Read full topic
item.source: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras

item.title: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
dky.tehkingd.u:

Strange. I was always able to run it on win 7 with no issues.

Hopefully the new C&C developers won’t royally eff up the next C&C game like the epic fail that C&C 4 was. Good thing they got rid of EALA as the EA RTS devs. Low budget + declining franchise/genre = halfassed game pumped out in several months’ time. :meh:

Its not so much W7, the problem was any os X64 as the installer is 16bit

Read full topic

item.title: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras
item.dc:creator: Luciel
item.description:
No, no blue tiberium in Tib Dawn, as ShakeSilver said, not until Tib Sun, this is because Blue tiberium is the advanced form of regular tib, and it requires years for it to achieve that status, and in tib dawn, tib had just been discovered so no blue tib could possibily be there.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
I’m having trouble getting past this gdi mission where you have to kill off a NOD convoy in the valley. I’m pretty sure I’m doing it wrong because I end up dieing in the valley.

Świrek:

harvesters+blue tiberium inside+enemy base=WIN

Did the original C&C have blue tiberium?

item.dc:creator: calhoun_freeman
item.description:

  2. HOW DO I PLAY THIS AGAIN?

Well, it was still fun as hell, and the music was, like always, groovy. Mmhm. Thanks Luciel.

item.title: Command & Conquer (95/Gold Edition) Modified to work on Vista/7 x64 + extras
item.dc:creator: CygNuS
item.description:
Awesome! Nice find.
I was 13 when this came out and was immediately hooked, funny to replay it nowadays with the inability to build more units at once
It used to drive my non-gaming father crazy when I played it in the living room with the constant annoying (not to me) EVA messages: “unable to comply building in progress… unit ready… unit ready… unable to comply building in progress”

Read full topic
